definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to jump out of the way
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to disperse/to scatter in all directions
to be scared out of one's wits (idiom)
to scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/to flee in all directions
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to scamper off/to scurry off like a frightened rat
(of a group of people) to run about helplessly
